description: Strike loses its power.
Strike slows a tap.
You maneuver for a a better  position. You have initiative.
You take a shot to foes side. You have the initative.
Light, but well placed strike. You are already starting your next attack
Mild strike to fos chest. He can see your next strike coming and he attempts to block it.
Foe is confused by your attack. He steps back to parry your next strike.
Strike bends Foes hip in an odd direction. He is unbalanced.
Fist to chest. A solid punch. Foe is rattled a little.
Blow on top of Foes foot is slightly misplaced, but quick. Bruise toe and mash toe nails.
Strike Achilles tendon. Foe almost falls. He recovers his balance, but the pain is strong.
Weak spearhand to Foes side. It yields an excellent effect.
Knife hand, spear hand combination. Foe must roll a weapon fumble.
Blow to Foes shield arm. If foe has a shield, it is broken. If foe has no shield, his arm is broken.
Kick to Foes weapon arm. Foe is disarmed. Your strike does little else.
Fluid move followed by a leaping kick to Foes back knocks foe down. He is shaken and tries to stand.
Strike to nerve in Foes leg. Foes leg buckles. He does not fall, he crouches down in pain.
You block Foes attack. You then follow-up with a side strike that knocks foe down. Foe hits hard and loses his direction.
Gooseneck strike. Foes inner ear ruptured. Foe stands there while your follow-up strike knocks him down and out!
Fine artistry, but no extra damage.
Your master would be so embarrassed.
Blow to shoulder. Foe steps back and yields the initiative to you.
Good shot! You have initiative for 2 rounds.
Strong, but poorly aimed strike forces foe to defend himself energetically.
Chest strike. Foe makes a strange noise on impact. He blocks and recovers.
Glancing kick to Foes back. The effects are reasonable for your modest effort.
Side strike sends foe stumbling to the left 5 feet. He recovers to face you.
Boom! Good shot to Foes stomach. He almost loses his lunch.
Kick in back of Foes leg. He stumbles, but does not fall. You move to gain advantage.
Strike foe in his forehead. The shock sprains neck and fractures Foes jaw. He cannot seem to close his jaw.
Spear hand strike to chest. Elbow shot to Foes side causes some confusion.
Hammer Foes weapon arm as it passes near you. The bruise is deep. Foe holds tight to his weapon.
You find an opening and strike the back of Foes knee. The impact damages tendons and unbalances foe.
Kick Foes weapon arm and send weapon flying 5 feet away. You break 2 of Foes weapons.
Wheel kick knocks foe flat. Smash tendons and tear muscle. You spin clear with too much energy.
Strike to Foes knee shatters joint. Foe drops down hard. He grips his nee and spits out an oath.
Roundhouse kick knocks foe out and fractures collarbone. Neck is sprained and shoulder muscles are bruised.
Knife hand strike to Foes weapon arm breaks bone. Kick to lower back breaks Foes backbone, leaving foe paralyzed from the waist down.
Glancing blow makes a strange sound.
Not so solid a strike.
Forceful. Foe steps back. You have initiative.
Hard strike. Foe lashes out to avoid your next attack.
Grab foe and bring your knee into his ribs. The force of the strike throws him from your grasp.
Clever feint finds an opening in Foes guard. Your strike is light and fast. Bruise Foes chest.
Step to the side and catch foe in his back. He stumbles forward. His guard is DOWN.
With a circular block and a focused central strike you break Foes defenses.
Strong wheel kick sends foe 10 feet in any desired direction.
Brutal strike to upper leg. The bruise is deep. The pain makes it hard for foe to stand on the leg.
Knife hand strike breaks Foes weapon arm, leaving it useless. Follow-up punchto solar plexus knocks foe out.
Strong knife hand to upper portion of Foes shield arm. Arm is broken.
Strike to back of lower leg. Foe struggles to keep balance. He is unable to defend himself.
You turn a block into a strike to Foes weapon arm. Foe is disarmed. Strike damages cartilage.
Heel kick breaks bone in Foes foot. Foe has trouble standing. His foot looks bad.
Clean strike to lower leg rips Achilles tendon and drops foe.
Flying kick to Foes back. You knock foe down, disarm him, and leave him in trouble.
Kick to Foes solar plexus. He stumbles back 10 feet. He falls very hard.
Sweep lays foe out and heel strike to Foes sternum collapses the ribcage. Foe is helpless and dies in 4 rounds.
You impress foe with your form.
Foe steps out of most of the strike.
Kick Foes side. He stumbles out of the way. You have the initiative.
Foe blocks your attack. He falls back to recover from your onslaught.
Blow to chest. Use your forehead in a brutal way to subdue foe. You have initiative for 3 rounds.
Chest strike. Foe falls forward onto one knee in front of you. His guard is down for a moment.
Solid chest strike. The impact confuses foe greatly. His ribs are fractured. He hates you.
Textbook shot to Foes upper leg. The bruise is deep. Foe does not fall down.
Back strike. Foe attempts to flee and then changes his mind.
Blow strikes a nerve in Foes upper leg. He is not in pain, but his leg is numb.
Grip Foes weapon arm. Dislocate the arm and then break it. Use your advantage to pull foe over and kick him in the face. Foe is knocked out.
Press your attack under the bottom of Foes ribcage. Knock the wind out of foe.
Firm flat palm strike to Foes collarbone. Bone is broken. Foe guard is down. It hurts him to raise his arm.
Strike and grip area behind Foes knee. Tendon and cartilage damage insures your success.
Kick to Foes leg is clean and mean. Leg is broken above the knee. Foe falls over slowly.
Open-handed blow to Foes adam's apple crushes Foes windpipe. Foe dies in 18 rounds of shock and asphyxiation.
Jab to Foes eyes blinds him. Crescent kick sends foe 10 feet in the direction you select.
Round house kick catches foe in back of head. You slam Foes head into the ground. Severe concussion. Foe dies of hemorrhage in 9 rounds.
Gooosh! Awesome spear hand strike finds seam, penetrates solar plexus and ruptures the heart. Foe dies instantly.
How did you botch this beautiful strike?
Glancing strike makes foe respect you.
You strike foe to unbalance him before you attempt a killing blow.
Snappy double shot to ribs. Crack! Ribs are fractured.
Side strike jars Foes kidneys. Heavy bruise to muscles. Foe steps right into that one. He is in pain.
Strike is solid. It turns foe around. You have a clean shot at Foes back next round, if you hurry.
Draw down Foes defenses with a feint and then hammer him in chest. Your tactics are acceptable.
Hip strike spins foe. He is suspicious of gravity and struggles to stay standing.
Shoulder strike. Foe is badly unbalances and unable to defend himself.
Draw out Foes weapon arm. You strike cleanly to disarm him. Textbook.
Simultaneous palm strike to both of Foes ears. Destroy Foes hearing and balance.
Elbow to solar plexus and back of fist to Foes face. Foe drops.
Kick Foes knee in backwards. Tendons and muscles are torn. Foe yells out frightfully in response.
Front kick to midsection doubles foe over. You follow with a knee strike which breaks Foes nose and knocks foe out.
Powerful strike shatters knee and then disjoints it. Foe drops. Oh that hurts!
Round house kick to kidneys drops foe to his knees. You grip Foes neck and snap it very effectively. Foe dies in 9 rounds.
Strike to abdomen ruptures spleen. Foe spits out blood instantly. He drops and dies in 12 rounds.
Double palmstrike to Foes nose breaks cartilage and drives bone into brain. The effects are rapid. Foe dies after 6 rounds prone and immobile.
Disarm foe and use his weapon to kill him. A follow-up strike breaks his neck and you send him 5 feet in any direction. He is dead twice.
